name: UAbilitySystemComponent
doc: The core ActorComponent for interfacing with the GameplayAbilities System

AffectedAnimInstanceTag: The linked Anim Instance that this component will play montages in. Use NAME_None for the main anim instance.
ActivatableAbilities:
The abilities we can activate.
        -This will include CDOs for non instanced abilities and per-execution instanced abilities.
        -Actor-instanced abilities will be the actual instance (not CDO)

This array is not vital for things to work. It is a convenience thing for 'giving abilities to the actor'. But abilities could also work on things
without an AbilitySystemComponent. For example an ability could be written to execute on a StaticMeshActor. As long as the ability doesn't require
instancing or anything else that the AbilitySystemComponent would provide, then it doesn't need the component to function.

methods.name: ApplyGameplayEffectSpecToSelf
methods.doc: Applies a previously created gameplay effect spec to this component

methods.name: ApplyGameplayEffectSpecToTarget
methods.doc: Applies a previously created gameplay effect spec to a target

methods.name: ApplyGameplayEffectToSelf
methods.doc: Apply a gameplay effect to self

methods.name: ApplyGameplayEffectToTarget
methods.doc: Apply a gameplay effect to passed in target

methods.name: ClearAbility
ClearAllAbilities
methods.doc: Wipes all 'given' abilities. This will be ignored if the actor is not authoritative.

methods.name: ClearAllAbilitiesWithInputID
FindAllAbilitiesMatchingQuery
FindAllAbilitiesWithInputID
FindAllAbilitiesWithTags
GetActiveEffects
methods.doc: Returns list of active effects, for a query

methods.name: GetActiveEffectsWithAllTags
methods.doc: Returns list of active effects that have all of the passed in tags

methods.name: GetAllAbilities
GetAllAttributes
methods.doc: Returns a list of all attributes for this abilty system component

methods.name: GetAttributeSet
GetGameplayAttributeValue
GetGameplayEffectCount
GetGameplayEffectCount_IfLoaded
GetGameplayEffectMagnitude
methods.doc:
Raw accessor to ask the magnitude of a gameplay effect, not necessarily always correct. How should outside code (UI, etc) ask things like 'how much is this gameplay effect modifying my damage by'
(most likely we want to catch this on the backend - when damage is applied we can get a full dump/history of how the number got to where it is. But still we may need polling methods like below (how much would my damage be)

methods.name: GetGameplayTagCount
methods.doc:
Returns the current count of the given gameplay tag.
This includes both loose tags, and tags granted by gameplay effects and abilities.
This function can be called on the client, but it may not display the most current count on the server.

@param GameplayTag The gameplay tag to query

methods.name: GetUserAbilityActivationInhibited
methods.doc:
This is meant to be used to inhibit activating an ability from an input perspective. (E.g., the menu is pulled up, another game mechanism is consuming all input, etc)
This should only be called on locally owned players.
This should not be used to game mechanics like silences or disables. Those should be done through gameplay effects.

methods.name: InputCancel
methods.doc: Sends a local player Input Cancel event, notifying abilities

methods.name: InputConfirm
methods.doc: Sends a local player Input Confirm event, notifying abilities

methods.name: IsGameplayCueActive
methods.doc: Allows polling to see if a GameplayCue is active. We expect most GameplayCue handling to be event based, but some cases we may need to check if a GameplayCue is active (Animation Blueprint for example)

methods.name: GiveAbility
GiveAbilityAndActivateOnce
MakeEffectContext
methods.doc: Create an EffectContext for the owner of this AbilitySystemComponent

methods.name: MakeOutgoingSpec
methods.doc: Get an outgoing GameplayEffectSpec that is ready to be applied to other things.

methods.name: PressInputID
methods.doc:
* Sends a local player Input Pressed event with the provided Input ID, notifying any bound abilities
*
* @param InputID The Input ID to match

methods.name: ReleaseInputID
methods.doc:
Sends a local player Input Released event with the provided Input ID, notifying any bound abilities
@param InputID The Input ID to match

methods.name: RemoveActiveEffectsWithAppliedTags
methods.doc: Removes all active effects that apply any of the tags in Tags

methods.name: RemoveActiveEffectsWithGrantedTags
methods.doc: Removes all active effects that grant any of the tags in Tags

methods.name: RemoveActiveEffectsWithSourceTags
methods.doc: Removes all active effects with captured source tags that contain any of the tags in Tags

methods.name: RemoveActiveEffectsWithTags
methods.doc: Removes all active effects that contain any of the tags in Tags

methods.name: RemoveActiveGameplayEffect
methods.doc: Removes GameplayEffect by Handle. StacksToRemove=-1 will remove all stacks.

methods.name: RemoveActiveGameplayEffectBySourceEffect
ServerCurrentMontageJumpToSectionName
methods.doc: RPC function called from CurrentMontageJumpToSection, replicates to other clients

methods.name: ServerCurrentMontageSetNextSectionName
methods.doc: RPC function called from CurrentMontageSetNextSectionName, replicates to other clients

methods.name: ServerCurrentMontageSetPlayRate
methods.doc: RPC function called from CurrentMontageSetPlayRate, replicates to other clients

methods.name: ServerPrintDebug_Request
methods.doc: Ask the server to send ability system debug information back to the client, via ClientPrintDebug_Response

methods.name: ServerPrintDebug_RequestWithStrings
methods.doc: Same as ServerPrintDebug_Request but this includes the client debug strings so that the server can embed them in replays

methods.name: ServerSetInputPressed
methods.doc: Direct Input state replication. These will be called if bReplicateInputDirectly is true on the ability and is generally not a good thing to use. (Instead, prefer to use Generic Replicated Events).

methods.name: SetActiveGameplayEffectLevel
methods.doc: Updates the level of an already applied gameplay effect. The intention is that this is 'seemless' and doesnt behave like removing/reapplying

methods.name: SetActiveGameplayEffectLevelUsingQuery
methods.doc: Updates the level of an already applied gameplay effect. The intention is that this is 'seemless' and doesnt behave like removing/reapplying

methods.name: SetUserAbilityActivationInhibited
methods.doc: Disable or Enable a local user from being able to activate abilities. This should only be used for input/UI etc related inhibition. Do not use for game mechanics.

methods.name: TargetCancel
methods.doc: Any active targeting actors will be stopped and canceled, not returning any targeting data

methods.name: TargetConfirm
methods.doc: Any active targeting actors will be told to stop and return current targeting data

methods.name: TryActivateAbilitiesByTag
methods.doc:
Attempts to activate every gameplay ability that matches the given tag and DoesAbilitySatisfyTagRequirements().
Returns true if anything attempts to activate. Can activate more than one ability and the ability may fail later.
If bAllowRemoteActivation is true, it will remotely activate local/server abilities, if false it will only try to locally activate abilities.

methods.name: TryActivateAbility
methods.doc:
Attempts to activate the given ability, will check costs and requirements before doing so.
Returns true if it thinks it activated, but it may return false positives due to failure later in activation.
If bAllowRemoteActivation is true, it will remotely activate local/server abilities, if false it will only try to locally activate the ability

methods.name: TryActivateAbilityByClass
methods.doc:
Attempts to activate the ability that is passed in. This will check costs and requirements before doing so.
Returns true if it thinks it activated, but it may return false positives due to failure later in activation.
If bAllowRemoteActivation is true, it will remotely activate local/server abilities, if false it will only try to locally activate the ability

methods.name: UpdateActiveGameplayEffectSetByCallerMagnitude
methods.doc: Dynamically update the set-by-caller magnitude for an active gameplay effect

methods.name: UpdateActiveGameplayEffectSetByCallerMagnitudes
methods.doc: Dynamically update multiple set-by-caller magnitudes for an active gameplay effect
